content: I just improved the regex validation on the primitive data types in the trunk version of FHIR. That's thrown up an issue: the regex for = is interpreted differently in XmlSpy and the Java schema library. It must be escaped for XmlSpy, and it must not be escaped for the Java schema library. Has anyone run into this, or have any work arounds?
The issue turned out to be something else, though we still have one example that's invalid.
The example was genuinely invalid. Whitespace had been inserted into the instance that didn't result in breaks on a 4-character (3-byte) basis.
